We are currently in the city of Krakow, which is very well known for its old architecture, medieval castles, old churches, and so on.
However, Krakow actually has a different side that not many people are aware of, and that is the district of Nova Huta.
This area was built here in the 1950s under the Polish Communist government to be located next to the steelworks plants that actually used to have the name of Vladimir Lenin.
And there's actually a particular reason why I was very excited to visit this place.

You see, guys, obviously if you follow my channel, you might know that I come from Russia, and I'm actually originally from the city of Chelyabinsk, which is one of Russia's main sort of industrial cities.
We have a lot of factories, and in my city we do actually have neighborhoods similar to this built around steelworks plants.
And actually this neighborhood of Novokhuta is usually compared a lot to Magnita Gorsk, which is another city located in the Chelyabinsk oblast where I originally come from.
And actually, even if you take a look at pictures of how the layout looks from up above this area in Magnita Gorsk, it looks eerily similar.
We're actually here right now in the very center of Nova Huta on the main square, which actually, ironically enough, now bears the name of Ronald Reagan.

And supposedly it was probably somewhere around here, but let's walk and see exactly where that was.
So originally when this neighborhood was built here, this was a time where, so to say, communist Poland was just beginning.
This was shortly after the Second World War.
And the idea behind this neighborhood actually here was to build something that would counter the center of the city of Krakow.
Because Krakow has always been a city that's been associated with kind of the intelligentsia, the upper class and so on.
And obviously when you're trying to build a communist state, you need to create a bit of an alternative.

So the idea behind this neighborhood was actually to create a bit of a, again, communist planned utopia built around the steelworks factory that would attract poor people and working class people, people from villages to come here and essentially settle and work at the factory.
And this is exactly how, you know, back in the Soviet Union as well, this is how things works.
They would literally build entire cities inside neighborhoods around a certain factory or a plant that's just been opened.
And Nova Huta is Poland's biggest neighborhood that's like this.
And actually the steelworks plan that this neighborhood was built around still works to this day.
Obviously it's no longer called Vladimir Lenin, but things haven't changed too much.
A lot of the people who still live here actually still work at the factory.

In fact, this is a building that was built here in spite the communist government of Poland at the time.
And actually what we have in front of us right now is a.
There you go, it's a church.
This right here is the Ark of the Lord church that started building here in the late 60s.
And it actually has a very, very interesting story.

The reason why it looks so strange and so bizarre is because obviously, if you know something about the Soviet Union and the Soviet satellite states, even though many of these countries, like Poland and Russia, for example, were very religious, very Christian for their entire history, during the communist times, religion was almost kind of frowned upon.
And obviously here in this neighborhood, which is supposed to be the ultimate communist utopia, a church was never planned.
And in fact, right after Nova Huta was built, the people who moved to this area were pretty unhappy about the fact that there was no church that they could visit.

And basically, since around the mid-1950s, this area right here behind me was a big point of contention between the local government and the local people, because the communist government of Poland really did not want to build a new church because it's not very fitting to the Ideology.
However, the people here actually fought pretty hard for it.
There was a lot of protests that were thrown.
The government and the people went back and forth.
Sometimes the government would kind of okay and give permission to the building of the church, but then they would change their mind once again.
And ultimately, in 1967, the government here actually gave people the permission to build the church.
But there was only one caveat.
The government would not help the people build the church in any way.
No funds and no resources, no nothing.
So this church was actually fully built by volunteers who collected their own construction materials, their own bricks, their own cements, everything.
And essentially, this church right here was built in spite of the government, by the people.
And the church was only finally finished in the year of 1977.
And once again, you can clearly tell that it doesn't really look right, like any regular church, like any church I've ever seen before.
